Title: Junior Portfolio Data Analyst
Description:
In a nutshell üìå

Position: Junior Portfolio Data Analyst

Location: Madrid, onsite

Experience: At least 1 year in data analysis or a similar role




Want to know more? üëá




INSUD PHARMA operates across the entire pharmaceutical value chain, bringing specialized knowledge and experience in scientific research, development, manufacturing, sales, and marketing of a wide range of active pharmaceutical ingredients (APIs), finished dosage forms (FDFs), and branded pharmaceutical products, adding value to human and animal health.

INSUD PHARMA‚Äôs activity is organized into three synergistic business areas: Industrial (Chemo), Branded (Exeltis), and Biotech (mAbxience), with over 9,000 professionals in more than 50 countries, 20 state-of-the-art facilities, 15 specialized R&D centers, 12 commercial offices, and more than 35 pharmaceutical subsidiaries serving 1,150 clients in 96 countries worldwide. INSUD PHARMA believes in innovation and sustainable development.

Are you ready to be a #Challenger? üí™




What are we looking for? üîé




Support the Business Development team in identifying, analyzing, and selecting products to develop, both generic and innovative.
Perform quantitative (market data) and qualitative (strategic evaluations) analyses within portfolio selection and new product development.
Regularly monitor competitor performance.
Create KPIs and dashboards to provide insights into the execution quality of the Business Development and Portfolio teams.
Develop benchmarks to monitor company performance against peers.
Understand and feel comfortable with clinical and scientific language.
Work on strategic or operational projects.




The challenge! üöÄ

√á

Translate business rules into data logic to support strategic decision-making.
Collaborate closely with different departments to ensure quality and relevance of analysis.
Present results in a structured, clear, and convincing manner.




What do you need? ü§ì




Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Business (double major or Master‚Äôs in Data Science is a plus). Knowledge in Health Sciences is valued.
At least 1 year of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role.
Proficiency in Python and SQL.
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar.
Excellent analytical and conceptual skills.
Effective communication skills in English, both written and verbal.
Investigative and curious mindset with strong ability to understand business rules and translate them into data logic.
Strong interpersonal skills and desire to work in a highly collaborative environment.




How will the selection process be? üïµÔ∏è




Initial contact by phone or email.
1 or 2 interviews, either virtual or onsite.
Continuous communication about the status of the process.




üî∑ Think this offer is not for you? üî∑

At INSUD PHARMA, we promote gender equality and ensure a work environment free from discrimination based on ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, disability, or any other condition. We value diversity and foster inclusion in all our hiring processes.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

AbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas ‚Äì immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care ‚Äì and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on X, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn and Tik Tok.

Job Description

The Data Analyst will work within Customer Engagement Analytics team in Spain, to provide technical expertise in Advance/Predictive/Prescriptive Analytics. The key responsibilities of the role will be to contribute to AbbVie Data Analytics projects and support Data Science projects. Should be highly analytical with love and high affinity for analysis, mathematics and statistics. Additionally, not only should be familiar with quantitative methodologies and programming but also keen on business acumen. The Data Analyst should have passion for data analysis, data quality and accuracy, data exploration, machine learning and out of the box thinking.

Key responsibilities:

Serve as a relevant member of Customer Engagement Analytics, working in close partnership with the rest of team member and Global Winning with Data team to implement global and local initiatives in the affiliate, becoming a trusted partner of the CEx local team.

Develop in collaboration with the commercial teams and other CEx teams, advanced analytics, identify synergies, optimize reporting strategy to generate business relevant outcomes.

Master in different Foundry datasets of varying complexity and size levels and develop new ways to generate creative predictive analytic solutions to work around data limitations.

Identify best practices and extend them to the rest of the organization in terms of repoting & analytics, Proactively identify new analytical approaches that would improve our ability to answer key business questions, by closely collaborating with key business partners to transform key business questions to insights.

Work with business stakeholders to define key business questions, requirements, timelines, objectives and success factors for winning with data initiatives.

Qualifications

BS degree in mathematics, statistics or engineering, computer science or economics complemented with a master in Big Data, Artificial Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, Machine Learning, Data Science or equivalent.

Portfolio of work demonstrating data science applications.

Minimum of 2 years of applied data science in fields such as data engineering, predictive modelling,

Experience developing and executing data analytica to address key business questions with positive and measurable outcomes.

Experience analyzing and drawing insights from key internally and externally generated data sets.

Essential skills:

Analytical reasoning abilities, intellectual curiosity, strong business acumen and creative problem solving.

Ability to interact effectively with/present to (verbally or written) to all levels of the organization.

Ability to be agile and nimble changing business conditions, strong collaborative relationships, teamwork across different functions and teams to contribute to productive culture.

Lead strategically and create trust within the team.

Additional Information

AbbVie is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to operating with integrity, driving innovation, transforming lives and serving our community.‚ÄØ Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled.

US & Puerto Rico only - to learn more, visit https://www.abbvie.com/join-us/equal-employment-opportunity-employer.html

US & Puerto Rico applicants seeking a reasonable accommodation, click here to learn more:

https://www.abbvie.com/join-us/reasonable-accommodations.html

Title: Data Analyst

üöÄ Data Analyst | Join a Fast-Growing FoodTech Startup in Madrid







üëã Who are we?

Founded in 2012, Take a Chef was born from the belief that exceptional culinary experiences should be accessible beyond traditional restaurant settings.

We envisioned a world where top-tier chefs could bring their talents directly to the dining tables of discerning individuals and families. üçΩÔ∏è

Combining cutting-edge technology üíª with a deep passion for food and hospitality ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçüî•, we‚Äôve become the leading global platform for high-quality private chef services.

Last year, we served over 500,000 clients in more than 100+ countries, working with a network of 70,000+ private chefs and partnering with renowned luxury travel brands like Airbnb, Onefinestay, Le Collectionist and more. ‚ú®







üéØ About the role

We‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst who‚Äôs passionate about turning complex data into clear, actionable insights. If you love understanding business challenges, building dashboards, and automating data processes to empower decision-making across teams‚Äîthis might be your next role.







üõ†Ô∏è Responsibilities

üîç Deeply understand our business, products, and processes through data
üìä Create and maintain dashboards to track key metrics and visualize insights

ü§ù Collaborate with cross-functional teams such as Product, Design, and Marketing to support their data needs
üß∞ Design scripts and tools to automate and streamline data extraction using Python, SQL, and APIs







‚úÖ Requirements

üéì Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field (e.g. Data Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics)
üíº At least 3 years of experience working as a Data Analyst
üß† Strong experience (2+ years) with SQL, BigQuery, and Dataflow
üöÄ Self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, autonomous environment
üåç Fluency in English and Spanish
üìä Experience with BI tools like Looker, Tableau, or Power BI
ü§ñ Proven track record of integrating AI solutions into day-to-day data analysis workflows (e.g., automating reports, enhancing data pipelines, building smart dashboards).
üìà Hands-on experience (2+ years) with HubSpot and Amplitude (nice to have)







Why choose us?

üíº Positive Work Environment: Thrive in a collaborative and innovative culture that values personal well-being and team spirit.
‚öñÔ∏è Work-Life Balance: We prioritize flexibility and support so you can flourish both professionally and personally.
üìö Employee Development: Paid training and workshops to help you grow and achieve your career goals.
üí∞ Competitive Compensation: We offer attractive salaries and annual bonuses to reward your impact.
üå¥ Paid Time Off: Enjoy 25 vacation days per year to relax, recharge, and explore your passions.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Madrid, Spain (Relocation Package Included)




Job Summary:

We are seeking a results-driven Data Analyst with strong experience in Tableau, SQL, and data analytics to support data-driven decision-making across the organization. The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing complex datasets, building insightful dashboards, and delivering actionable business intelligence to key stakeholders.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop, maintain, and enhance interactive dashboards and reports using Tableau and other BI tools
Analyze large datasets using SQL to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that support strategic business decisions
Work with business stakeholders to understand data requirements and translate them into functional BI solutions
Perform gap analysis between legacy systems and new data platforms to ensure reporting continuity
Validate and reconcile data across different sources to ensure accuracy, completeness, and consistency
Communicate complex findings in a clear, concise, and business-friendly manner through reports, visualizations, and presentations
Assist in defining and documenting data definitions, business rules, and report specifications

We are seeking a results-driven Data Analyst with strong experience in Tableau, SQL, and data analytics to support data-driven decision-making across the organization. The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing complex datasets, building insightful dashboards, and delivering actionable business intelligence to key stakeholders.

Title: Junior BI Analyst
Description:
Overview: The position of Junior BI Analyst is an entry-level role. The role will include managing ad-hoc reporting/visualization tasks for production, sales, client reporting and more functions in the company.




Description:

Design & implement reports, dashboards, and visualizations using data visualization business intelligence tools
Optimize reporting dashboards with a focus on user experience, performance, flexibility, testability, and standardization
Working closely with stakeholders to understand requirements and provide the best possible solution
Make complex concepts simple and easy to understand by those around you through effective communication, planning and strategic execution
Maintain documentation for design, development and reporting work
Work within our systems and with BI team members to achieve high standards of data integrity, ensuring supporting metrics are accurate and complete
Working within team processes, data governance and security frameworks




Required Skills:

At least 1 year of experience working in a BI environment
Experience using Business Intelligence tools, such as Tableau or PowerBI
Experience in creating interactive dashboards
Minimum Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent / in the process of completing those studies.
Ability to learn new skills quickly
Ability to maintain professionalism, focus and result-orientation under pressure and tight deadlines
Attention to detail
Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal) in English
Exceptional problem-solving/critical thinking skills
Experience working in a corporate environment




Desired Skills:

Exposure to Knime, Request Tracker (RT), Snowflake
Prior translation industry experience
Understanding of relational databases
Fluency in a foreign language

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Embat was born to design the best way for medium and large sized enterprises to plan their finances and monitor their cash flow in real time.




We are building a financial management platform that allows them to understand what has happened in the past, track what is happening today and forecast the future of their businesses.




Our mission is to build a product that leverages technology and excellent client experience to empower our clients to make the best business decisions by accessing the best financial information, 100x more efficiently than using Excel files.




Our solution translates into savings of up to 75% of the time that financial teams spend on manual tasks. This allows them to focus on what matters most: making a greater impact within their organization and achieving a better balance between personal and professional life.




Our platform is already the trusted treasury management software of a large number of medium and large-sized corporates in Europe.




Composed of a fantastic team of people of 80+ members with different backgrounds and nationalities.




Backed by reputable international investors with the ambition to make Embat global and a great place to work! We are backed by top-tier international VCs.




In February 2024, we closed our third round of investment worth 15 million euros! This has been led by the renowned international investment fund Creandum, with the invaluable support of our partners Samaipata, 4Founders Capital, VentureFriends, Hugo Ar√©valo and Martin Blessing.




As a Data Analyst, you will join our Data team and also work closely with Sales, Marketing, and Customer Success to help scale Embat‚Äôs commercial engine through data.




We‚Äôre looking for someone with 0‚Äì2 years of experience, curious by nature, and excited about turning raw data into insights. You‚Äôll help the team track performance, identify bottlenecks, uncover opportunities, and ultimately make better, faster decisions.




We pride ourselves on working in an agile, collaborative environment, with daily interaction across teams. You‚Äôll have ownership from day one and the space to grow your skills with guidance from experienced peers.




What will you do?





Support the collection, cleaning, and transformation of data from different tools (CRM, marketing platforms, customer success platforms).


Build and maintain dashboards and performance reports related to revenue, pipeline, marketing and retention.


Execute ad-hoc analyses to solve real business problems and communicate findings clearly to stakeholders.


Contribute to improving data accuracy by identifying inconsistencies and working cross-functionally to solve them.


Help document key metrics, sources and logic used in reporting processes.


Identify and help implement process automation and self-serve reporting opportunities.


Learn how to work with business teams and translate their questions into data-driven insights.
What are we looking for?


0‚Äì2 years of experience in data-related roles


Technical background (engineering, math, physics, statistics, economics or similar). Other degrees welcome if paired with a data bootcamp or master‚Äôs.


Basic SQL and Python knowledge


You are comfortable with numbers, and have high attention to detail


You are proactive, eager to learn, and a problem-solver by nature


You enjoy working cross-functionally with teams from different backgrounds


Strong communication and structured thinking


You speak Spanish fluently and have a working level of English
What comes with working at Embat?


We offer a platform that allows you to reach your professional and personal goals.


A competitive salary according to the project and responsibility.


English Classes.


Hybrid working setup & flexible schedule.


Latest technology of your choice to do your impactful work with.


Access to private health insurance with Sanitas.


Access to salary on demand, restaurante card, transport card, and kindergarten checks through Payflow.


Career progression - Twice-yearly performance reviews.


An opportunity to work hand in hand with our founders who built their careers in Investment Banking at J.P. Morgan for more than a decade


Team Buildings plans

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Codefinity¬†is a game-changing platform born in Kyiv in 2021, sparking a global coding revolution! We empower millions with top-tier courses in Python, SQL, JavaScript, and beyond, helping everyone from beginners to pros level up their tech skills. Trusted by students at MIT, Stanford, and pros at Microsoft, Amazon, and Tesla, we‚Äôre all about innovation, creativity, and impact. Join us to shape the future of tech education and make a real impact! üíªüåü




Are you interested in participating in the development of a platform that will be used by millions of users around the world? Do you want to help thousands of people enter the world of programming, data analysis, machine learning? Do you want to work in a team where your opinions and ideas really matter? If your answer to all the questions is yes, it's a match!




Responsibilities:

Find patterns in user behavior at all stages of the lifecycle
Build statistical models to predict conversion, retention, feature usage and other key metrics
Build recommendation engine to help users match with best content
Support marketing, content, product and development teams by conducting ad hoc analysis
Contribute to engineering/ improving data pipelines




Requirements:

Knowledge of general-purpose programming language (e.g. Python)
Proficiency in SQL and Excel
Academic background in mathematics/ statistics/ computer science
English Upper -Intermediate or higher
Passion for Data Science
Understanding of A/B testing methodologies




What do we offer:

Work within an ambitious team on a socially impactful education product
20 working days of annual paid vacation
Medical insurance and full sick leave compensation
Access to our corporate knowledge base and professional communities
Personal development plan
Compensation for English language learning, external training, and courses

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Wood Mackenzie is the global data and analytics business for the renewables, energy, and natural resources industries. Enhanced by technology. Enriched by human intelligence. In an ever-changing world, companies and governments need reliable and actionable insight to lead the transition to a sustainable future. That‚Äôs why we cover the entire supply chain with unparalleled breadth and depth, backed by over 50 years‚Äô experience. Our team of over 2,400 experts, operating across 30 global locations, are enabling customers‚Äô decisions through real-time analytics, consultancy, events and thought leadership. Together, we deliver the insight they need to separate risk from opportunity and make confident decisions when it matters most.

WoodMac.com

Wood Mackenzie Brand Video

Wood Mackenzie Values


Inclusive ‚Äì we succeed together
Trusting ‚Äì we choose to trust each other
Customer committed ‚Äì we put customers at the heart of our decisions
Future Focused ‚Äì we accelerate change
Curious ‚Äì we turn knowledge into action


Job Description

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Wood Mackenzie‚Äôs Power and Renewables Data team.

This role will focus on the analysis, programmatic acquisition, and preparation of data for delivery to our customers and research teams.

Wood Mackenzie Produces Research And Data That The Energy Industry Relies On To Understand And Navigate The Energy Transition. Examples Of Products That You Will Contribute To Include


Power supply and demand long-term outlooks
Power market pricing history and long-term outlooks
Renewable technology supplier leaderboards


Responsibilities


Own the quality and delivery timeline of critical datasets
Obtain, transform, and deliver information from our databases to support industry analysis using Excel, PowerQuery, PowerBI, GraphQL, SQL, Sisense, Python, and Snowflake
Create and maintain workflows for internal stakeholders
Create and maintain data pipelines to feed customer facing products
Identify and assess opportunities for optimization of our systems, processes, and datasets
Monitor and resolve alerts in production environments to preserve the integrity of our products
Identify internal and external sources of data that will support customer needs
Collaborate with colleagues across multiple time zones and disciplines to uncover pain points, process improvements, and product requirements


About You


At least 2 years of experience in a data analyst or data engineering role
Experience working in environments reliant on SQL, Python, and Snowflake
Experience with ETL processes and APIs for data integration
Hands on approach to problem solving that delves into the details while maintaining the ability to succinctly propose solutions to steer management decisions
Independently completes projects given time and platform constraints
Desire to play a key role in the energy transition by delivering the data and research that catalyzes progress
Intellectual curiosity about the provenance of data and journey it makes to arrive at a destination
Passionate ownership of projects and excitement to share accomplishments with fellow Woodmackers
Preferred: Experience in the energy industry or power modelling domain
Fluent in English. Bonus language skills: Mandarin, Spanish


Equal Opportunities

We are an equal opportunities employer. This means we are committed to recruiting the best people regardless of their race, colour, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. You can find out more about your rights under the law at www.eeoc.gov

If you are applying for a role and have a physical or mental disability, we will support you with your application or through the hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst Intern (Python & API Focus)
Description:
We're Celonis, the global leader in Process Mining technology and one of the world's fastest-growing SaaS firms. We believe there is a massive opportunity to unlock productivity by placing data and intelligence at the core of business processes - and for that, we need you to join us.

The Team:

The Business Analytics team uses our own Celonis software to do data analytics globally for the entire Go To Market organization. This situates the team in an advantageous position, bridging the gap between business operations, technical solution development, and product development as power users of our own Software. For anyone in data analytics, this is a great opportunity to grow and continue a career since Celonis is the industry-leading in process mining technology.

The Role:

As an Intern, you will play a key role in shaping analytics and data products that drive strategic decision-making, business performance and optimization across multiple internal business units. You will work hands-on with new product features, sometimes even before they are publicly released, and help push the boundaries of data analytics capabilities to create valuable and impactful solutions.

As an Intern, you will contribute to projects focused on developing a technical solution to enhance the visibility and performance of the team in charge of creating sales opportunities. You will gain a practical understanding of how data-driven insights and scalable data tools can enhance the operations to drive results. This internship offers a unique opportunity to collaborate with system teams, Go-to-Market business managers, and Strategy & Operations teams, applying your analytical and technical skills to contribute to impactful solutions within a fast-paced environment.

The work you‚Äôll do:


Gather, process, and analyze business data using company technology, ensuring data is structured to support business goals, needs, and opportunities.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity through regular data quality checks, validation processes, troubleshooting and enhancements to maintain reliable datasets.
Integrate multiple data sources into our Celonis platform using Python and API calls to develop a technical solution that enhances the business development team's visibility and performance through a purpose-built tool in our platform.
Build actionable insights and recommendations to drive better business outcomes.
Enable the team to effectively use the tool by bridging the gap between data metrics and business meaning, ensuring informed decision-making.
Participate in internal initiatives aimed at enhancing data ingestion, data quality, model development, tool creation, and the development of enablement materials and documentation. These collaborations will focus on optimizing data solutions to increase their efficiency, effectiveness, and overall value for the organization.


The qualifications you need:


On going studies in Data Science, Engineering, Big Data /Business Analytics or a comparable technical degree program with outstanding performance.
Proficient in utilizing SQL, Python, and/or BI tools for data analysis and visualization
Experience in working with data ingestion, data transformations, databases and data visualizations is a plus
Working experience in the enterprise software industry is a plus
Think analytically, work in a structured manner, and quickly comprehend new topics and complex interrelationships to present and explain them to our stakeholders in a reliable and independent manner.
Possesses a strong intrinsic motivation to take ownership of tasks and a proactive approach to managing responsibilities, demonstrating the ability to identify key priorities and follow through with determination. Exhibits the potential to prioritize their workload and take accountability for their contributions.
Demonstrates proactive communication skills and a willingness to bridge the gap between technical concepts and business objectives. Shows initiative in seeking to understand business needs, effectively communicate ideas, and engage with stakeholders. Eager to learn and apply their initiative to contribute meaningfully to team goals and drive impact.
Have very good knowledge of spoken and written English (German and/or Spanish are a plus)
Available from ASAP


What Celonis Can Offer You:


Pioneer Innovation: Work with the leading, award-winning process mining technology, shaping the future of business.
Accelerate Your Growth: Benefit from clear career paths, internal mobility, a dedicated learning program, and mentorship opportunities.
Receive Exceptional Benefits: Including generous PTO, hybrid working options, company equity (RSUs), comprehensive benefits, extensive parental leave, dedicated volunteer days, and much more. Interns and working students explore your benefits here.
Prioritize Your Well-being: Access to resources such as gym subsidies, counseling, and well-being programs.
Connect and Belong: Find community and support through dedicated inclusion and belonging programs.
Make Meaningful Impact: Be part of a company driven by strong values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future.
Collaborate Globally: Join a dynamic, international team of talented individuals.
Empowered Environment: Contribute your ideas in an open culture with autonomous teams.


About Us:

Celonis makes processes work for people, companies and the planet. The Celonis Process Intelligence Platform uses industry-leading process mining and AI technology and augments it with business context to give customers a living digital twin of their business operation. It‚Äôs system-agnostic and without bias, and provides everyone with a common language for understanding and improving businesses. Celonis enables its customers to continuously realize significant value across the top, bottom, and green line. Celonis is headquartered in Munich, Germany, and New York City, USA, with more than 20 offices worldwide.

Get familiar with the Celonis Process Intelligence Platform by watching this video.

Celonis Inclusion Statement:

At Celonis, we believe our people make us who we are and that ‚ÄúThe Best Team Wins‚Äù. We know that the best teams are made up of people who bring different perspectives to the table. And when everyone feels included, able to speak up and knows their voice is heard - that's when creativity and innovation happen.

Your Privacy:

Any information you submit to Celonis as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Celonis‚Äô Accessibility and Candidate Notices

By submitting this application, you confirm that you agree to the storing and processing of your personal data by Celonis as described in our Privacy Notice for the Application and Hiring Process.

Please be aware of common job offer scams, impersonators and frauds. Learn more here.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Ebury is a global fintech firm dedicated to empowering businesses to expand internationally through tailored and forward-thinking financial solutions. Since our founding in 2009, we‚Äôve grown to a diverse team of over 1,700 professionals across 40+ offices and 29+ markets worldwide. Joining Ebury means becoming part of a collaborative and innovative environment where your contributions are valued. You‚Äôll play a key role in shaping the future of cross-border finance, while advancing your own career in a dynamic, high-growth industry.

Data Anayst

Madrid Office - Hybrid: 4 days in the office, 1 day working from home

Join Our Data Team at Ebury Madrid Office.

Ebury is looking to add a Data Analyst to our Analytics team. You will work with business stakeholders to gather requirements and will deliver insight solutions to leverage data to drive growth across different verticals.

What We Offer


Competitive salary and benefits package
Discretionary bonus based on performance
Continued personal development through training and certification
We are Open Source friendly, following Open Source principles in our internal projects and encouraging contributions to external projects


Responsibilities


Understand and model complex business processes from Underwriting and Lending operations.
Partner closely with key stakeholders to translate business needs into data requirements, analytical models, and automated solutions.
Design, develop, and maintain robust and scalable data models using dbt to transform data into reliable, analytics-ready datasets.
Ownership and maintenance of data products. Solving and preventing data quality issues.
Act as a data-driven consultant for our Product and Business teams. Interact with key decision-makers to model potential outcomes, support the architecture of new lending products, and measure their performance post-launch.
Create and maintain powerful dashboards and reports in Looker and LookerStudio to monitor Key Performance Indicators, track portfolio health, and communicate insights clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Collaborate with different stakeholders to launch new products


About You


3+ years of experience
Experience managing and querying large datasets using SQL
Experience using Python to manipulate data
Fluency in written and spoken English, a must
Clear and direct communication skills about complex, technical topics
Track record of working autonomously with organisational and time management skills
Ability to work under pressure to meet tight deadlines while maintaining high attention to detail
Extreme ownership and accountability for work
Experience working in Financial Services, Capital Markets, Insurance a plus
Knowledge of football market, a plus


If you‚Äôre excited about this job opportunity but your background doesn‚Äôt match exactly the requirements in the job description, we strongly encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other positions we have.

About Us

Ebury is a FinTech success story, positioned among the fastest-growing international companies in its sector.

Founded in 2009, we are headquartered in London and have more than 1700 staff with a presence in more than 29 markets worldwide. Cultural diversity is part of what makes Ebury a special place to be. From Sao Paulo to Dubai, Vancouver to Auckland, we enjoy sharing team experiences and celebrating success across the Ebury family.

Hard work pays off: in 2019, Ebury received a ¬£350 million investment from Banco Santander and has won internationally recognised awards including Financial Times: 1000 Europe's Fastest-Growing Companies.

None of this would have been possible without our proudest achievement: our great people. Enthusiastic, innovative and collaborative teams, always ready to disrupt and revolutionise the fast-paced FinTech sector.

At Ebury, we‚Äôre committed to building a workplace where everyone feels valued, supported, and empowered to thrive. We‚Äôre proud to have active employee networks and ESG initiatives that reflect our inclusive culture, including our Women‚Äôs Network, LGBTQIA+ Network, and Veterans Network. These communities provide spaces for connection, mentorship, advocacy, and collaboration across our global teams.

We believe in inclusion. We stand against discrimination in all forms and have no tolerance for the intolerance of differences that makes us a modern and successful organisation. At Ebury, you can be whoever you want to be and still feel a sense of belonging no matter your story because we want you and your uniqueness to help write our future.

Please submit your application on the careers website directly, uploading your CV / resume in English.

About Us

Ebury is a FinTech success story, positioned among the fastest-growing international companies in its sector.

#LI-MERKLE

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Radisson Hotel Group is one of the world's largest hotel groups with ten distinctive hotel brands, and more than 1,460 hotels in operation and under development in 95+ countries. The Group‚Äôs overarching brand promise is Every Moment Matters with a signature Yes I Can! service ethos.

People are at the core of our business success and future. Our people are true Moment Makers and together we bring the culture, spirit, environment and opportunities that empower you to be your best, every day, everywhere, every time. Together, we make Every Moment Matter.

We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to support the development of actionable insights that drive business decisions across the organization, with a strong focus on finance. This role will contribute to the development of the business partnering function and collaborate closely with the rest of the BI team to deliver timely, accurate, and relevant data and analysis.

You will play a key role in designing data models, building dashboards, and delivering information through SAP BW, SAP Analytics Cloud, SAP Datasphere, and Power BI platforms. Reporting to the Business Intelligence Manager, you will work closely with business stakeholders to translate their needs into scalable, data-driven solutions.

KEY ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:



Provide support to business stakeholders during the Finance month-end close process.
Analyze, reconcile, and validate financial data across systems.
Gather and analyze business requirements to support reporting and analytical needs.
Design and implement a Data Analytics Framework to standardize practices across the organization.
Develop data models based on stakeholder requirements, ensuring accuracy and performance.
Build, test, and document dashboards and reports using SAP and other BI tools.
Deliver actionable insights to end-users, driving informed decision-making.
Support the BI Manager and Business Partners with regular and ad-hoc analysis.
Ensure alignment with the corporate BI strategy and contribute to its successful execution.
Train and coach end-users to effectively use BI tools and reports.



REQUIREMENTS:



2‚Äì3 years of professional experience in business intelligence or financial analysis.
Strong analytical skills and ability to work with large datasets.
Advanced Excel and PowerBI skills, including PowerPivot, PowerQuery and MDX.
Hands-on experience with the following tools:
SAP BW / SAP BPC
SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC)
SAP Datasphere
Power BI
Solid understanding of relational databases and data modeling concepts.
Experience in data projects across the full lifecycle: warehousing, modeling, integration, and analytics.
High level of personal responsibility, service minded, strong work ethic, and organizational skills.
Clear communication skills, both verbal and written.
Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines.
Fluency in English is required; Spanish is a strong plus.


WHAT ABOUT YOU:



You collaborate effectively and are comfortable working in a remote or hybrid environment.
You can work independently, prioritize tasks, and manage time effectively.
You are confident in working with numerical data and drawing insights.
You demonstrate strong communication skills and a positive, proactive attitude.
You are adaptable and thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced setting.
You are comfortable working in a matrix organization.
You build strong relationships with stakeholders at all levels.
You are confident interacting with senior business stakeholders.



Skills

Business Intelligence

Analyst

BI

You will play a key role in designing data models, building dashboards, and delivering information through SAP BW, SAP Analytics Cloud, SAP Datasphere, and Power BI platforms. Reporting to the Business Intelligence Manager, you will work closely with business stakeholders to translate their needs into scalable, data-driven solutions.

KEY ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:


  • Provide support to business stakeholders during the Finance month-end close process.
  • Analyze, reconcile, and validate financial data across systems.
  • Gather and analyze business requirements to support reporting and analytical needs.
  • Design and implement a Data Analytics Framework to standardize practices across the organization.
  • Develop data models based on stakeholder requirements, ensuring accuracy and performance.
  • Build, test, and document dashboards and reports using SAP and other BI tools.
  • Deliver actionable insights to end-users, driving informed decision-making.
  • Support the BI Manager and Business Partners with regular and ad-hoc analysis.
  • Ensure alignment with the corporate BI strategy and contribute to its successful execution.
  • Train and coach end-users to effectively use BI tools and reports.


REQUIREMENTS:


  • 2‚Äì3 years of professional experience in business intelligence or financial analysis.
  • Strong analytical skills and ability to work with large datasets.
  • Advanced Excel and PowerBI skills, including PowerPivot, PowerQuery and MDX.
  • Hands-on experience with the following tools:
    • SAP BW / SAP BPC
    • SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC)
    • SAP Datasphere
    • Power BI
  • Solid understanding of relational databases and data modeling concepts.
  • Experience in data projects across the full lifecycle: warehousing, modeling, integration, and analytics.
  • High level of personal responsibility, service minded, strong work ethic, and organizational skills.
  • Clear communication skills, both verbal and written.
  • Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines.
  • Fluency in English is required; Spanish is a strong plus.

WHAT ABOUT YOU:


  • You collaborate effectively and are comfortable working in a remote or hybrid environment.
  • You can work independently, prioritize tasks, and manage time effectively.
  • You are confident in working with numerical data and drawing insights.
  • You demonstrate strong communication skills and a positive, proactive attitude.
  • You are adaptable and thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced setting.
  • You are comfortable working in a matrix organization.
  • You build strong relationships with stakeholders at all levels.
  • You are confident interacting with senior business stakeholders.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
¬°Hi! ¬°We are Cheil Spain! üöÄ




Cheil Worldwide is a full-service agency from brand building to digital transformations creating excellent data-driven experiences for every customer. As part of Cheil Worldwide, Cheil Spain plays its part in one of the world‚Äôs biggest agency networks ‚Äì comprising 53 offices and 8 affiliates in 43 countries globally with more than 6.000 employees and 600 clients around the world. Cheil Spain is made up of 100 employees from different disciplines, who are passionate about innovation in all its forms. We offer a wide variety of marketing and advertising services, including strategy and planning, creative, content production, traditional and digital media advertising, influencer marketing, event marketing, e-commerce and performance marketing, among others.




‚úîÔ∏è Your role at Cheil: Data Analyst




‚úîÔ∏è What we are looking for?




We are looking for a highly analytical and business-driven Senior Data Analyst to join our Performance team at Cheil Spain. This role will play a critical part in unlocking insights from web and CRM data to improve user experiences, increase conversions, and inform strategic decisions for Samsung Spain and Portugal.

The ideal candidate has strong expertise in Adobe Analytics and GA4, and a solid understanding of user behavior analysis, segmentation, and digital marketing KPIs. Bonus if you're familiar with SQL, Python, BigQuery, and Qlik.




‚úîÔ∏è Key Responsibilities:




Support CRM and performance initiatives through audience segmentation, behavior analysis, and campaign performance reporting.
Evaluate Campaigns, promotions, marketing channels attribution, the funnel, and much more for the understanding of the customer journey, identifying insights with clear business recommendations
Analyze user journeys and web behavior through Adobe Analytics and GA4 to identify performance trends, drop-offs, and optimization opportunities.
Create dashboards and reports using tools such as Adobe Workspace, Looker Studio, or Power BI to track performance and support internal and client decision-making.
Collaborate closely with UX, CRO, Paid Media, and CRM teams to align data strategies and contribute with actionable insights.
Define KPIs and measurement frameworks for digital marketing initiatives and validate technical tracking implementations (with support from GTM specialists if needed).
Deliver recurring and ad hoc reports for always-on and campaign-based activities, including funnel analysis, campaign attribution, and ecommerce performance.
Present insights clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, connecting data findings with business objectives.
Continuously monitor data quality, track implementation, and propose process improvements to strengthen data-driven decision-making.




‚úîÔ∏è Key Skills & requirements:




4+ years in a Digital Data Analyst role, ideally within an agency or ecommerce environment.
Advanced expertise in Adobe Analytics and Google Analytics 4.
Proven ability to extract, visualize, and present insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience building dashboards and reports using Looker Studio or Power BI.
Strong understanding of digital marketing campaigns, ecommerce KPIs, and data quality validation.
Excellent storytelling and presentation skills in PowerPoint.
Strong communication and teamwork skills, with a strategic business mindset.




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with SQL, BigQuery, and Python for data querying and automation tasks.
Understanding of website tagging and event tracking via Google Tag Manager.
Knowledge of Adobe Audience Manager or other CDP tools.
Previous exposure to e-commerce platforms and CRO/UX concepts.
Familiarity with A/B testing frameworks and marketing attribution models.
Fluent in Spanish and English.




Languages:

C1 level of English required, with advanced English writing skills and the ability to communicate effectively with international teams and external suppliers.




‚úîÔ∏è We would like you to bring together attitudes that have to do with...




Working effectively with individuals of diverse cultures, interpersonal styles, abilities, motivations, or backgrounds.
Making the most effective use of the capabilities, insights, and ideas of all individuals.
Inspiring others by generating innovative solutions in work situations .
Trying different and novel ways to deal with work problems and opportunities.
Working effectively and cooperatively with others.
Establishing and maintaining good working relationships.
Setting high goals for personal and group accomplishment.
Tenaciously working to meet or exceed goals by proactively confronting difficult issues.
Establishing and sustaining trusting relationships by accurately perceiving and interpreting one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô emotions and behavior.
Leveraging insights to effectively manage one‚Äôs own responses and reactions.




‚úîÔ∏è Cheil offers you:




üå±Work in a growing environment, focused on creating and innovating with multidisciplinary and multicultural teams in Creativity, Digital Performance, Retail, Data and Technology.

‚úçÔ∏èStable position: Permanent contract because we want you to be part of Cheil and be able to develop with us.

üí∏Salary: To be negotiated based on experience. Bonus Performance.

üìñInternal training opportunities.

‚ù§Ô∏èSocial Benefits: Restaurant Tickets and Medical Insurance.

üïõTimetable from Monday to Thursday from 09.00-18.15 and Fridays from 09.00-15.00. July and August, we have an intensive working day, Monday to Friday from 8:00 - 15:00.

üíªHybrid working model.

üèñÔ∏è22 days of annual leave, plus 24 and 31 December and Advertising Day.

üí∞Possibility of incentive for attracting new clients and new employees to Cheil. Help us to keep growing!

üìçWe are located in Alcobendas and we have a direct bus service, 100% free, with departures from Plaza Castilla, Chamart√≠n and Nuevos Ministerios to our offices.




‚úîÔ∏è Next steps:




Are you motivated by what you have just read? Join Cheil!

If you are passionate about the world of advertising and have experience leading teams, we invite you to send your CV and cover letter. We hope to have a high-level professional who will help us continue to grow in the market.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

THE WORLD OF UBISOFT

Ubisoft is a global leader in gaming with teams across the world creating original and memorable gaming experiences, from Assassin‚Äôs Creed, Rainbow Six, to Just Dance and more. We believe diverse perspectives help both players and teams thrive. If you‚Äôre passionate about innovation and pushing entertainment boundaries, join our journey and help us create the unknown!

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile‚ÄØbrings together dedicated and experienced professionals that are focused on crafting high-quality F2P games for mobile. We strongly believe in the core values at the centre of our Ubilife, which encourage us to take ownership of our work, continually striving for excellence while promoting the sharing of knowledge across individuals and teams, without losing our sense of enjoyment and fun, while taking care for one another. We strive for a safe and respectful workplace for all team members and we‚Äôre transparent about the measures we are taking to do so. For this reason, Ubisoft‚Äôs Code of Conduct has been released publicly on our corporate website for all current and future team members.

Do you want to join us in the world of mobile gaming? If so, read on!

Job Description

YOUR DAILY ADVENTURE

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile is currently seeking a Data Analyst to help our team on their next adventure. The Data Analyst will support insight initiatives for our BI team and will be reporting to our Director of Data & Analytics. Your daily adventure:



Turning data into actionable insights, by performing hands-on research, data exploration and analysis, to drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention, and monetization.
Work with the game teams to provide insights into user behaviour, answer key business questions and support in AB test design and analysis.
Carry out projects on machine learning for behavioural segmentation and monetization.
Debugging and problem-solving issues to ensure the delivery of accurate and clear analysis, reports and tools.
Effectively communicate results and insights to senior stakeholders throughout the organization.
Coordinate, challenge and share the best analytical practices and methods within the organization.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in Machine Learning technologies and Data Science trends.
Contribute to the knowledge base and culture of the team.



Qualifications

YOUR SKILLS

Are you serious about fun? Do you consistently seek out learning opportunities and aim to beat your high score? Are you open to new ideas, perspectives and cultures and believe that it takes a world to build a world? At Ubisoft, you‚Äôll work alongside passionate and talented teams who are imagining the future of entertainment.



Master's degree in a quantitative field (i.e. Physics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science...). PhD in any of these disciplines is a plus.
5+ years relevant work experience in similar positions, ideally in mobile gaming industry.
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis
Experience with cloud-based big data solutions such as Redshift, BigQuery.
Solid knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Microstrategy, etc.
Robust understanding of advanced statistics suitable for analysis of skewed populations.
Experience designing effective ways of communicating, visualising and reporting results/analysis.
Experience in predictive analytics and segmentation.
Excellent problem-solving capabilities with strong attention to details.
Work permit for Spain obtained prior to applying for the position is a must.



What can make you stand out:



Experience with Agile philosophies (e.g.: Scrum, Kanban, XP) and project management tools (e.g.: JIRA)
Software engineering skills, including best practices like CI/CD and Git.
Self-motivation, organization skills, team spirit, proactivity.
Passion for games. Interest in mobile F2P games.



Additional Information

YOUR LIFE AT UBISOFT BARCELONA MOBILE (and PERKS)



Hybrid work model.
Possibility for new parents to work from home 80% of the time.
Flexible working hours: 40-hour workweek with start times between 8 AM and 10 AM (or from 7:30 AM when working onsite to avoid traffic jams), and early leave from 4 PM (Fridays from 2 PM).
Reduced schedule‚ÄØ(35 hrs per week) in July and August, Easter, Christmas holidays, and special days like Sant Jordi and Revetlla de Sant Joan.
Personal Matters Hours:‚ÄØ24 hours paid for by Ubisoft that you can use for personal matters.
Holidays:‚ÄØ25 days per year + 1 day in your‚ÄØUbi-Birthday.
5 extra holiday‚ÄØdays‚ÄØon the year you celebrate your 5th/10th/15th/20th year with us.
Ticket Restaurant: 210‚Ç¨ per month, and‚ÄØFlexible compensation plan‚ÄØ(Ticket Transport & Ticket Nursery).
Health insurance‚ÄØwith Cigna, including‚ÄØPhysiotherapist & Psychology sessions‚ÄØwith a reduced price.
Life Insurance‚ÄØwith AXA.
Mobile Device‚ÄØGrant‚ÄØof 400 EUR‚ÄØstarting on your 1st year in the company.
Language trainings‚ÄØin English, Spanish, and French.
Professional development training & programs, based upon request.
Ubisoft games with discount‚ÄØand Uplay PC for free.
Locally roasted craft coffee‚ÄØby INCAPTO (it‚Äôs very, very good).



Ubisoft is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that reflects the diversity of our player community. We are an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, religion, gender sexual orientation, age or disability status.

Title: Data Analyst (They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

THE JOURNEY


Work closely with multi-disciplinary teams to define the business roadmap and strategy, monitor and give visibility of operations metrics and KPIs.
Apply various advanced mathematical and statistical modeling techniques and analyses (experimentation, machine learning, causal inference, etc.) to solve for product and business problems that drive the highest impact.
Translate business questions and hypotheses into analysis and actionable insights.
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Foster strong relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business, and product.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


3-5 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role.
A higher education in scientific discipline such as Physics, Statistics, Computer Science or Mathematics.
Knowledge or experience in digital product development.
Demonstrable experience with the application of statistical modeling and advanced analytics to provide strategy-shaping insights.
Mastery in SQL and statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Demonstrated experience in designing and analyzing experiments in digital products (A/B test, multivariate, etc).
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI.
Excellent spoken and written English.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
We Are Waiting for You

Hi there!

I am Laura the recruiter for this position (and hopefully, your future colleague!).

First, a little bit about what I like the most about working at ServiZurich: The environment here is incredibly collaborative and innovative. Our tech-driven mindset fosters continuous learning and growth, creating an atmosphere where everyone can thrive. Now, I can't wait to share this exciting journey with you at the Zurich!

Let me take a wild guess: you‚Äôve probably sifted through countless job offers today, and they all seem to blur together. Sound familiar? Well, here‚Äôs the scoop: At Zurich, we might not have all the answers (and we‚Äôre not striving for perfection!), but we‚Äôve got something special. Curious? Keep reading!

First off, THANK YOU for considering our company. We understand that finding the right opportunity can be tough, but I‚Äôll try to make it easier.

Who Are We?

Let me introduce us. You‚Äôre reading about Zurich Insurance Group, a global leader in insurance, but this role specifically pertains to ServiZurich. Established in Barcelona in 2006, ServiZurich operates as an integral part of Zurich Insurance Group, providing cutting-edge technological solutions and support to Zurich's local and global business units.

In addition to our technological solutions, we excel in investment, administration, and accounting, ensuring comprehensive support for Zurich's diverse operations.

What Can You Expect?

Would you like to start your professional career in a multinational environment?

If you‚Äôre someone who wants to influence your own development, if you are passionate about data and analytics, someone that wants to be part of a young and motivated team and help us make a difference, this is your opportunity! We are seeking recent graduates, who are interested in developing their professional career in one of the world‚Äôs leading insurance groups through a personalized training and development program.

This position offers you the experience to learn within an international environment providing you support, mentoring and development opportunities in new projects.

And you might be thinking: This is great, what will my day-to-day be like, at Zurich? I‚Äôm glad you asked ‚Äì I asked myself the same question at the time.

In this role, you will be part of the Reporting and Analytics Team within Group Investment Management and perform the following duties:


Design and implement solutions based on data & analytics in Investment Management
Enable the business to draw actionable insights out of complex data sets
Translate reporting requirements into business intelligence solutions
Work alongside experts in various technological domains.
Enhance your skills with real-world experience
Contribute to a team that values your input and creativity.


Your role will involve building relationships with:


Stakeholders on local, regional and group levels
Investment back-office and middle-office teams
Market and Master Data teams
IT teams


What Makes You a Great Fit?

While we‚Äôre not seeking perfection or expecting you to save the world, we believe that if you meet some of these requirements, you‚Äôll be a fantastic fit for our team. We are waiting for you!

As a Junior Data Analyst your education and personal skills will ideally include:

Education skills:


Bachelor or Master¬¥s degree in either Finance, Economics, Information Technology and/or quantitative fields such as Statistics and Math with good academic record
Data Science studies are a plus
Fluent in written and spoken English


Technical skills:


Experience with data engineering and analysis
Experience with Power BI visualization tool is a must
Strong coding skills (preferably SQL, Python or Spark)
Proven analytical and problem-solving skills
Databricks knowledge is a plus
Machine Learning is a plus


Personal skills:


Ability to work with multi-cultural project teams and facilitating workshops with stakeholders
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Creative thinking and intellectual curiosity


The following areas of knowledge would be very helpful to a candidate to successfully fulfil this role:


Knowledge of data analytics including data transformation, modelling, and visualization
Business Analyst skills (e.g., requirement engineering, design thinking)
Understanding of insurance industry, financial products, financial markets as well as the main accounting principles


And‚Ä¶ What Makes Us Special?

As well as a competitive salary and a yearly bonus, we offer:


To support your work-life balance, we have adopted a flexible working model.
Over 300 euros to set up your home office and additional monthly home office allowance.
Wide range of internal and external trainings, including English and Spanish classes depending on the needs.
Ticket restaurant and Health Insurance with the flexibility to exchange it for other benefits.
Life and accident insurance.
Collective Life retirement Plan
2000 referral bonus if you bring other talented people like you to the company.
Special banking and insurance conditions plus Exclusive Employees discounts
Functional diversity benefits
Different social clubs such as hiking, investment, beach volley and many more


Where Are We Located?

Via Augusta, Barcelona.

We Are Waiting for You.

It‚Äôs a match? Don‚Äôt wait any longer! Apply by sending your CV in English.

If not, no worries! We‚Äôll meet again in the future. Feel free to share my contact details with anyone you think would be a great fit.

At Zurich, we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best-qualified individuals available, regardless of race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, or disability.

ServiZurich‚Äì Your Talent, Our Strength

Why Zurich

At Zurich, we like to think outside the box and challenge the status quo. We take an optimistic approach by focusing on the positives and constantly asking What can go right?

We are an equal opportunity employer who knows that each employee is unique - that‚Äôs what makes our team so great!

Join us as we constantly explore new ways to protect our customers and the planet.


Location(s): ES - Barcelona
Remote working: Hybrid
Schedule: Full Time
Recruiter name: Laura Santamar√≠a Rodr√≠guez

Title: Data Analyst Junior- Control Tower
Description:
Description

The EU External Fulfilment (EF) network consists of circa 35 operations which offer flexible solutions to the CF network operated by external providers (3PL providers). EU EF primarily provides: (1) network capacity solutions (storage/throughput), (2) special operation solutions (Hazmat, BWS, IXD, SDC, ICC, etc) and (3) emerging market penetration solutions. EU EF is currently undergoing an operational transformation, driving demand for enhanced expertise in Outbound (OB).

The goal of EU 3PL Control Tower is to provide an excellent operational end to end, 24/7 support, in 3PL buildings across European/UK External Fulfillment chain. We aim to provide the standardized and optimized process with frustration free communication. This role is for a highly driven and motivated individual with operational experience and innovative, hands-on approach.

This position involves the daily operational tasks resolutions and day to day communication with 3PL and Amazon team of problem solvers and node managers on their KPIs management.

The successful candidate will be responsible for: a- Provide reactive/proactive support to 3PL Providers and Amazon internals, b- Work on internal Projects to improve/automate 3PL Control Tower services. This person has a strong delivery record, attention to details and will be able to work independently with limited supervision.

This job involves 3PL operations monitoring and ops support, within a team that covers 24/7 shift pattern, for 30+ buildings in Europe/UK.

The shift to cover is Night Shift: 10pm CET to 6am CET, Sunday to Thursday (Friday and Saturday: days off).

Key job responsibilities


Providing the operational guidance to 3PL
Being a communication bridge between 3PL and Amazon stakeholders
Mitigating CX risk by CPT management support, resolving OB errors and managing shipment cancellations
Supporting on Transportation escalations.
Uploading critical data for supply chain and transportation visibility
Checking process and Amazon standard compliance
Optimization of actual Control Tower Outbound processes, aiming to automatize the actual tasks of the team, applying BI skills.
Work on Projects to improve actual 3PL Control Tower services, and capture new services that can be scalable to all 3PL sites.


Basic Qualifications


- Relevant experience working with the MS Office suite (Word, Excel, Outlook)
- C1 English level
- Spanish C2 level


Preferred Qualifications


High school or equivalent diploma.
Focus on details and analytical approach.
Expertise in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, AI, etc.
Experience in logistics.


Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you‚Äôre applying in isn‚Äôt listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

Job ID: A3046653

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Barcelona - Spain

Flexible working: 60% home office / week‚ÄØ

Job type: Permanent, Full time‚ÄØ - Hybrid

About The Job

At Sanofi, we're committed to providing next-gen healthcare through the power of data insights and AI. As a Data Engineer in our Manufacturing & Supply Digital Data Foundations team, you'll play a crucial role in transforming raw data into actionable insights that drive innovation and business value. You'll be part of an exciting journey to revolutionize our manufacturing processes through data-driven decision making.

We are an innovative global healthcare company with one purpose: to chase the miracles of science to improve people's lives. Our Digital Data & Technology organization is transforming Sanofi into an AI-driven powerhouse, creating trusted, high-quality data platforms that enable better decision-making across our global operations.

Main Responsibilities


Design and implement robust data engineering pipelines for Manufacturing & Supply systems, including SAP S4/HANA, QMS, LIMS, and MES
Create and maintain data integration solutions with comprehensive lifecycle management
Develop data visualization solutions using design-thinking approaches to deliver high-value products
Collaborate with cross-functional teams in agile pods to understand and translate business requirements
Ensure data quality and compliance with regulatory requirements (Data Privacy, GxP, SOX)
Build and optimize data models to support Manufacturing & Supply analytics needs


About You


Experience in data engineering and ETL/ELT development, particularly with Informatica/IICS and DBT/Airflow
Strong SQL skills and proficiency in Python for data transformation
Knowledge of data governance principles and quality assessment methodologies
Experience with cloud technologies, preferably AWS
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or related field
Agile mindset with excellent communication and collaboration skills


Why choose us?


Drive innovation at the intersection of healthcare and technology
Develop your expertise with cutting-edge data and AI platforms
Enjoy a thoughtful rewards package that recognizes your contribution
Take advantage of flexible working arrangements and comprehensive health benefits
Work with global teams on transformative digital initiatives
Access continuous learning opportunities and career growth paths


nullPursue Progress. Discover Extraordinary.

Join Sanofi and step into a new era of science - where your growth can be just as transformative as the work we do. We invest in you to reach further, think faster, and do what‚Äôs never-been-done-before. You‚Äôll help push boundaries, challenge convention, and build smarter solutions that reach the communities we serve. Ready to chase the miracles of science and improve people‚Äôs lives? Let‚Äôs Pursue Progress and Discover Extraordinary ‚Äì together.

At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams in agile pods to understand and translate business requirements
  • Ensure data quality and compliance with regulatory requirements (Data Privacy, GxP, SOX)
  • Build and optimize data models to support Manufacturing & Supply analytics needs

About You

  • Experience in data engineering and ETL/ELT development, particularly with Informatica/IICS and DBT/Airflow
  • Strong SQL skills and proficiency in Python for data transformation
  • Knowledge of data governance principles and quality assessment methodologies
  • Experience with cloud technologies, preferably AWS
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or related field
  • Agile mindset with excellent communication and collaboration skills

Why choose us?

  • Drive innovation at the intersection of healthcare and technology
  • Develop your expertise with cutting-edge data and AI platforms
  • Enjoy a thoughtful rewards package that recognizes your contribution
  • Take advantage of flexible working arrangements and comprehensive health benefits
  • Work with global teams on transformative digital initiatives
  • Access continuous learning opportunities and career growth paths

nullPursue Progress. Discover Extraordinary.

We invest in you to reach further, think faster, and do what‚Äôs never-been-done-before. You‚Äôll help push boundaries, challenge convention, and build smarter solutions that reach the communities we serve. Ready to chase the miracles of science and improve people‚Äôs lives? Let‚Äôs Pursue Progress and Discover Extraordinary ‚Äì together.

Title: Data Analyst - Business Performance Analytics
Description:
What You'll Do:

As part of the Business Performance Analytics (BPAX) team within Sales Strategy, your primary mission will be to deliver robust, intuitive, and actionable business insights that empower Criteo‚Äôs CRO and Commercial leaders to shape and drive the company‚Äôs commercial strategy.

You will apply a data-driven approach to uncover insights and explain business performance. This role involves working with large and complex datasets, requiring strong analytical curiosity, creativity in data exploration, and the ability to synthesize findings into a compelling narrative that supports strategic decision-making.

Your Mission


Build advanced analytical views to decode and communicate global performance patterns
Perform in-depth competitive analyses, measuring the business impact of competitors‚Äô activities across key markets
Leverage external and internal data to understand client behavior, identify high-value client clusters (e.g., through CLTV studies), and qualify the potential of clients and prospects across new and existing business areas
Size business growth opportunities and risks, and translating findings into actionable recommendations for multiple levels of stakeholders



Who You Are:


2‚Äì3 years of experience in a similar analytics role (experience in AdTech is a plus)
A Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in a quantitative field (e.g., Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, or Business)
Strong analytical skills and intellectual curiosity, with the ability to structure and solve complex problems
Solid understanding of statistical modeling and data interpretation
Hands-on experience with SQL for data manipulation and extraction
Proficiency in Python for data analysis
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Power BI and/or Tableau
Strong presentation skills (including PowerPoint), with the ability to translate complex data into clear business insights and actionable recommendations
Business acumen and the ability to act as a trusted advisor to commercial stakeholders
Excellent communication skills and fluency in English
A proactive, autonomous mindset, with the ability to manage multiple projects, set milestones, coordinate with cross-functional teams, and drive initiatives forward



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is a leader in commerce media, helping brands, agencies, and publishers create meaningful consumer connections through AI-powered advertising solutions. We‚Äôre shaping a more open and sustainable digital future for advertising.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices across the globe or from the comfort of home, our 3,600 Criteos collaborate together to build an open, impactful, and forward-thinking environment.

We foster a workplace where everyone is valued, and employment decisions are based solely on skills, qualifications, and business needs‚Äînever on non-job-related factors or legally protected characteristics.

What We Offer:

üè† Own your work style ‚Äì Build your work around your life and not the other way around.

üìà Grow with us ‚Äì Learning, mentorship & career development programs.

üí™ Your wellbeing matters ‚Äì Health benefits, wellness perks & mental health support.

ü§ù A team that cares ‚Äì Diverse, inclusive, and globally connected.

üí∏ Fair pay & perks ‚Äì Competitive salary, equity, performance-based rewards and family-friendly policies.

Additional benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo.

Job Responsibilities
