Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
The Swiss-based DocMorris AG is a leading company in the fields of online pharmacy, marketplace and professional healthcare with strong brands in Germany and other European countries. With its business model, DocMorris offers its patients, customers and partners a broad range of products and services. In doing so, DocMorris is pursuing its vision of creating a digital health ecosystem for everyone to manage their health in one click.

In Spain and France, the company operates the leading marketplace for health and personal care products in Southern Europe. With an innovative business model, our marketplace does not manage stock or warehouses, it integrates the catalog of products, pricing, and stock levels of the most important and trusted off-line pharmacies in a single website, achieving 24h delivery service for more than 200.000 products and 10.000 brands from more than 1.000 pharmacies and health stores. Our business model and service have received several awards like the prize for Best Webshop in Spain as well as the Best Mobile App from the E-Commerce Awards.

We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our Data team, reporting to the Head of Data and working side by side with the business, finance, marketing, and engineering teams, to help extract the full value from our data in order to ask and answer questions, make decisions, and optimize, all to improve the experience for our customers and marketplace sellers by helping our internal teams with the appropriate data and reports.

Tasks and Responsibilities:


Follow-up and analysis of the main KPIs related to marketing, business, operations and finance in order to detect deviations, propose improvement actions, facilitate the decision-making process, and to detect/prevent potential loss of business faster.
Continuous development of efficient/automated reporting dashboards, tools, and processes to support decision-making.
Assisting stakeholders in the usage of the various existing systems and datasets available within the company and driving the development of new solutions.
Ad-hoc analysis to assist different teams in the decision making process, such as evaluating the performance of A/B Tests.
Prepare the monthly presentations for Business review meetings and Boards.
Support CFO, CMO, Marketing managers and SEO manager in the process of preparing the annual Budget and Rolling forecast.
Collaborate with and support the different teams inside the company, serving as the link and translator between these stakeholders and the data team, managing, clarifying, and defining their requests.


What we are looking for:


Professional Experience:
Minimum 2 year experience as a Data Analyst.
Experience in a customer-centric company, preferably e-commerce, transactional marketplace, or e-health, is a plus.
People Skills:
Excellence: in organization, planning and execution. Focus on details and ability to work under pressure and prioritize. Experience with Agile is a plus.
Proactivity: proposes new ideas and is able to work independently.
Ownership: takes on every challenge with responsibility until we find the solution. Problem solving mind-set.
Team: accustomed to collaborating with many stakeholders from multiple departments, solving problems together and sharing in achievements, failures, successes.
Highly analytical skills: obsession with data and continuous improvement.
Professional Skills:
Proficiency in the use of Excel.
Experience using a BI tool. Qlik Sense is a plus.
Good command of SQL.
Knowledge of Python or similar programming language.
Languages: Spanish and English (proficiency).
Domain knowledge (marketing, business, finance, operations, logistics) is a plus.


Our Benefits


Ticket restaurant 11‚Ç¨/day worked
25 days of holiday
Birthday day-off + 50‚Ç¨ voucher to spend on our website!
Health insurance with Sanitas is paid by PromoFarma (for those who want it!)
Social benefits package. You can dedicate a part of your gross salary to Ticket Transport or Nursery.
Opportunity to participate in the employee participation program (stock options)
10% discount on our website on each purchase and up to 30% discount on DocMorris branded products
Access to eLearning platforms such as LinkedIn Learning
Individual training opportunities and budget for personal development
Access to corporate wellness plattform "Wellhub" (ex Gympass) with various offers on gyms, studios, guided classes, workouts and wellness app
Access to mobile consultations with medical specialists, lawyers or veterinarians via "Doctor i "
Great employee events and annual company celebrations

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

We‚Äôre all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they‚Äôre looking for in their local communities ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.

What You‚Äôll Do & Who You Are

We are looking for an exceptional Data Analyst to join the Coches.Net, Motos.Net and Milanuncios.com team.

You will work as a member of multidisciplinary team, collaborating closely with Product owners, cluster teams, data engineers and management team stake-holders (Marketing, Sales, Product, BizDev and other Operations teams).Your main mission is to define and execute analyses of several business context to identify trends, opportunities and problems to improve the offering and services we offer.

These Will Be Your Functions


Identify, analyse and interpret KPIs and Health Metrics related to our users and customers, creating dashboard and visualisation to monitor them.
Identifying trends, risks and opportunities to provide insights that can make recommendations on how to improve the different initiatives of the vertical.
Create powerful Insights using Advanced analytics to improve the knowledge of our users and customers.
Actively participate in the discovery, and development of advanced analytical models (such as clustering, and predictive models), into their implementation in business use cases, such as customer segmentation, and propensity models for upselling, downselling, and churn prediction.


Qualifications


3+ years of experience in eCommerce, an online company.
Advanced knowledge of SQL and relational databases
Advanced knowledge of Python and/or R for data analysis (e.g. pandas, numpy, matplotlib), and advanced analytics (e.g. scikit-learn)
Advanced user of at least one visualisation tool such as Tableau and/or QlikSense.
Analytical skills: know how to interpret data, to extract relevant insights and be able to translate business questions into analytical needs Nice-to-have
Experience working with sales, operations, and strategy teams.
Good knowledge of basic machine learning algorithms (e.g. clustering, classification, regressions)
Some experience with big data technology (e.g. databricks, datalakes)
Some knowledge of data engineering tools (e.g. Airflow, DBT)Nice-to-have
Experience working with sales, operations, and strategy teams.
Good knowledge of basic machine learning algorithms (e.g. clustering, classification, regressions)
Some experience with big data technology (e.g. databricks, datalakes)
Some knowledge of data engineering tools (e.g. Airflow, DBT)


Benefits

Life at Adevinta comes with its perks! Our Adevintans enjoy the following benefits:


An attractive Base Salary üí∏
Participation in our Short Term Incentive plan (annual bonus) üèÜ
Work From Anywhere: Enjoy up to 20 days a year of working from anywhere! Maybe not from the moonüåõwell why not! just make sure you have internet connection! üåç
A 24/7 Employee Assistance Program for you and your family, because we care ‚ù§Ô∏è
Win together, lose together is one of our key behaviours. At Adevinta you will find a collaborative environment with an opportunity to explore your potential and grow üå±


On top of these, we also provide a range of locally relevant benefits. Wanna know more? Apply and ask our recruiters! ‚ú®

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don‚Äôt meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don‚Äôt meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

Title: Data Analyst - App Analytics Team (m/f/d)
Description:
Your Tasks


Continuous requirements engineering and consulting towards your product teams to implement data analytics projects
Work closely with our data engineers, tracking specialists and app developers to ensure a high quality of data
Define key performance indicators, identify the correct data sources and connect them by retrieving data via SQL and setting up dynamic reports and dashboards
Supporting the definition, documentation and refinement of web tracking concepts for our product teams in close collaboration with app developers and data analysts
Measure the effectiveness of your improvements by applying and evaluating A/B/n test


Your Profile


Master degree in a technical and/or mathematical-related subject (e.g. statistics, physics, engineering sciences, industrial computer sciences or the like)
Good SQL knowledge
Experience in defining and implementing tracking concepts within hybrid app solutions (especially Google Analytics 3 and 4) is a plus
First Experience with server side tracking implementation would be desirable
First Experience with a standard BI reporting tools (Tableau, Google Data Studio, PowerBI, Qlik, SAP Business Object)
Kowledge of statistical methods and principles (e.g. A/B/N testings, regression analysis ‚Äì experience with Firebase is a plus)
Very good knowledge of English, German is a plus


About Us

MediaMarktSaturn is Europe‚Äôs leading consumer electronics retailer. It sees itself as a partner, daily companion and navigator for its customers in the digital world. Its over 1,000 MediaMarkt and Saturn stores are closely integrated with their online shops. MediaMarktSaturn has a total headcount of more than 60,000.

MediaMarktSaturn Technology is working on making Europe's number one consumer electronics retailer the technology leader in its sector. To this end, several hundred developers, UX designers and system architects using state-of-the-art technology work hand in hand with business owners in agile teams to develop customer-focused technology solutions for more than 6 million customers every day in 11 countries.

Technology Hub located in Barcelona, is one of the service units of MediaMarktSaturn Technology to deliver adequate staffing and engineering skills for the agreed deliveries of the global deployment plan for the entire group.

Additional Benefits


Young environment, where not everything is written in stone, and where you are expected to contribute and co-create the culture of the Tech Hub and international collaboration model
You'll have a 10% discount on the entire MediaMarkt website, so you can treat yourself at a lower price whenever you want!
On top of your compensation package, you can request Flexible Pay ‚ÄúMediaFlex program‚Äù (a.e. Ticket Restaurant, Private Health Insurance with Adeslas, ‚Ä¶)
Flexible working time and possibility to combine home office / presential working. Intensive workday every Friday and during summer
The possibility to choose between 2 offices: The first one is the MediaMarkt Spain HQ with a very attractive menu at a price. You'll eat for less than ‚Ç¨4! And the second office is located at Pier01, in Barceloneta, right in the center of Barcelona. Free coffee and free fruit once a week
If you need a VISA, don't worry, we'll assist you with the visa process and accompany you throughout the entire process!
There is a training budget so you can continue developing the skills you need most to keep growing professionally and personally!
We offer language classes: English, Spanish, and German
On your birthday, you won't work! It's a day for you to enjoy without thinking about work
You'll be working with the most cutting-edge technological stack of the moment

Title: Finance Data Analyst
Description:
About Us

At Docplanner Group, we‚Äôre on a mission to help people live longer, healthier lives. As the world‚Äôs largest healthcare platform, each month, we connect 24 million patients with 280k doctors across 13 countries (through brands like ZnanyLekarz, Doctoralia, MioDottore, DoktorTakvimi, and jameda). Our marketplaces, SaaS and AI tools simplify daily tasks and help doctors, clinics and hospitals work more efficiently, so they can focus on what really matters: caring for their patients.

Learn more about our products here: pro.doctoralia.es

Why Join Us?


üìä Real impact ‚Äì We help doctors help patients. Your work truly makes a difference.
üìà At scale, yet agile ‚Äì 3,000+ employees, but still fast, flexible, and hands-on.
üí∞ Pre-IPO & growing ‚Äì We‚Äôre backed by leading VC funds including One Peak Partners, Goldman Sachs Asset Management, and Point Nine Capital, raising a total of approx. ‚Ç¨400m to date. Now, we‚Äôre focused on profitability and IPO preparation. It‚Äôs an exciting time to join us.
‚ú® Shape the future, sustain growth ‚Äì Make a difference now *and* build for long-term success.


Job Description

The new team member, working within the Financial Reporting team, will play a key role in supporting the evolution of financial reporting in a challenging and stimulating environment. You will help bridge the gap between finance and BI. Our primary objective is to assist the business in making decisions based on data, with a particular emphasis on producing reports as the primary and most reliable source of information.

A team of 12 experts provides support to various departments, including marketing, sales, customer success, finance, and people experience, for both short-term and long-term projects. Collaborating closely with stakeholders, we strive to develop reports, analyses, models, and recommendations that enable us to gain a deep understanding of how we can enhance the satisfaction of both doctors and patients.

You will be an integral part of the Financial Reporting team, working closely with the Data Analytics team to support business decisions based on data.

How would you be impacting our mission


Financial Reporting and Analysis: Track key financial metrics and KPIs, ensuring they align with organizational goals; Develop and maintain comprehensive financial dashboards using advanced BI tools; Provide detailed insights into financial performance, trends, and variances; Provide insights for long-term strategic decisions;
Data Management and Integration: Ensure accurate and timely collection of financial data from systems like Oracle NetSuite; Integrate data from multiple sources for a unified financial view;
Performance Measurement: Analyze profitability and cost efficiency to identify improvement areas;
Regulatory and Compliance Reporting: Support audits and for regulatory documentation;
Automation and Process Improvement: Automate repetitive financial tasks to improve efficiency; Implement process improvements to reduce manual efforts and errors;
Enhanced Reporting and Visualization: Utilize BI tools like Tableau for dynamic, interactive reports and dashboards; Enhance report quality and accessibility beyond traditional spreadsheets.


Qualifications

What will help you thrive?


Bachelor's degree in Economics, Statistics, Econometrics or a related field.
Demonstrable experience in using SQL to derive actionable insights, either in commercial or academic setting (must have).
Knowledge of Python/R and desire to expand your knowledge.
Experience with statistical modeling and descriptive statistics.
Experience in partnership with internal stakeholders.
Experience in leading and executing end to end BI projects.
Strong written and oral communication skills in English; proficiency in other languages such as German, Spanish, and Italian is a plus.
Ability to gather, organize, analyze, and report large volumes of financial data with speed and accuracy.
Strong attention to detail with the ability to provide high-quality work efficiently.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to adapt and work in a quickly changing environment, managing competing demands.


Which skills are ‚Äòbonus points‚Äô?


Master's degree in Economics, Statistics, Econometrics or a related field.
Able to take a step back from the technicalities and examine them through a business lens.
Open to cooperating with a lot of people from many teams in different countries.
Like to see the instant effects of your work.
Knowledge of ERP finance applications (Oracle, Oracle - NetSuite, SAP).
Relevant experience in accounting and financial reporting.


Additional Information

What to Expect from Our Hiring Process

Role

We like to keep things transparent and efficient! Here‚Äôs what the process usually looks like (though it might vary slightly depending on the role):

1Ô∏è‚É£ Intro Chat ‚Äì A first call with our Talent Acquisition Partner to explore mutual fit around relevant skills, value alignment, and motivation.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Hiring Manager Interview ‚Äì A deeper dive into your experience and aspirations with your future manager, who you‚Äôll be reporting to in this role. Take this chance to ask anything on your mind‚Äîit‚Äôs just as much about making sure we‚Äôre the right fit for you, too.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Second Hiring Manager Interview

4Ô∏è‚É£ Business Case Presentation & Team Meeting

Why You‚Äôll Love It Here

üíô Global Benefits ‚Äì No matter where you are, you‚Äôll have access to:


Healthcare insurance ‚Äì so you can focus on what matters.
Wellness that works for you ‚Äì from gym memberships to mental health support, we‚Äôve got you covered.
Time off that counts ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs a vacation, your birthday, or just a day to recharge, we believe in balance.
ESOP (Employee Share Ownership Plan) after 6 months with us‚Äîbecause we believe in sharing our success!


üìç Local Perks ‚Äì Depending on your location, you will be entitled to local benefits like meal vouchers (ticket restaurant), transport allowances, or extended parental leave.

üöÄ Career Growth ‚Äì We‚Äôre growing, and so can you! You‚Äôll find lots of chances to learn, develop, and explore new paths‚Äîwhether within your team or through cross-functional projects.

üåé A Truly Global Team ‚Äì Work with talented people from all over the world in a diverse and inclusive environment.

‚è≥ Flexibility That Works for You ‚Äì Remote work and flexible hours aren‚Äôt just buzzwords here. While the extent of flexibility depends on your role and team, we value results over rigid schedules. Prefer an office setting? You're welcome at any of our hubs in Barcelona, Warsaw, Curitiba, Rio de Janeiro, Mexico City, Bogot√°, Munich, Rome or Bologna.

Please note: At this time, we are not able to sponsor visas for this position. To apply, you must already have the legal right to work in your country of residence or the location of the role.

What We Believe In

At Docplanner, our values guide everything we do:

üìä Focus on results ‚Äì we're here to make an impact.

üß† Think like an owner ‚Äì take responsibility, drive outcomes.

‚úÇÔ∏è Keep it simple, keep it lean ‚Äì smart solutions over complexity.

üîä Be respectful and radically honest ‚Äì openness builds trust.

üìö Learn and be curious ‚Äì growth is part of the job.

Don‚Äôt just take our word for it‚Äîcheck out our Glassdoor to hear what our people say!

_________________________________________________________________________

We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We welcome applicants from all walks of life, regardless of gender, disability, or background, and are dedicated to fostering an inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and empowered to contribute.

Title: BI Analyst Intern (6-month full time)
Description:
What You'll Do:

The Global Reporting Team's mission is to identify, define, produce, and automate sales/business/finance performance reporting portfolio. As the scope of the GRT is so wide, this is a unique opportunity not only to develop your technical skills, but also to learn more about different areas of our business and make an impact, while working in a fast paced environment.

Criteo and our stakeholders are constantly finding new ways to innovate, and our reporting suite is critical for tracking progress. As an intern, alongside the rest of the team you will be responsible for :


Working with stakeholder to analyze and understand their business needs to translate them into technical requirements
Building, running and updating existing reports based on the company needs and transformations
Exploring, validating and fixing data issues to provide high quality service to Criteos
Maintaining and improving processes (specification, procedures, and user training material).



Our objective is that by the end of the internship, you have developed the skills and experience to work in data.

Who You Are:


Degree from a business or quantitative field
Must be eager to learn, proactive and analytical
Excellent communication skills in English (spoken and written)
You are versatile, self-driven, detail-oriented, and hands-on
You value teamwork and building rapport with individuals
You have a demonstrated interest in Internet and technology
Bonus: experience in Excel (pivot tables, vlookup, etc.), PowerPoint, SQL, and BI restitution tools such Power BI (or equivalent)



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Digital Data Analyst
Description:
Who are we?

Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1,000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade ‚Äì this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We‚Äôre focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.

At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:

Brief Call: Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!

Interviews (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!

Case study: Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.

As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.

We look forward to meeting you!

Title: FinOps Reporting & Data Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

We‚Äôre all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they‚Äôre looking for in their local communities ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.

What You‚Äôll Do & Who You Are

Adevinta is undergoing a major Finance transformation, establishing a new global operating model supported by both local and centralized functions (OTC, P2P, R2R) and a global BPO partner (in Cluj and Bangalore).

As a FinOps Reporting & Data Analyst, you will play a key role in enabling data-driven decision-making by delivering accurate, insightful and timely financial reports across Finance Operations. You will partner closely with Global Process Owners to support operational performance, ensure compliance, and drive process efficiency ‚Äî especially within Order-to-Cash (OTC), Procure-to-Pay (P2P) and Record-to-Report (R2R) processes.

This is a highly analytical and business-oriented role, where understanding the underlying financial processes is just as important as strong technical reporting skills. The role can be based in Barcelona or Amsterdam, working in a hybrid model as part of an international team.

Key Responsibilities


Design and automate performance dashboards using Power BI, Tableau, or Looker for real-time visibility into OTC, P2P, and R2R metrics
Collaborate with Global Process Owners and Finance Systems teams to gather requirements and deliver impactful reporting solutions
Analyze operational and financial performance, identify risks and inefficiencies, and present actionable insights to senior stakeholders
Support compliance by ensuring reporting is aligned with internal control frameworks and external audit requirements (e.g., SOX)
Consolidate and validate data from SAP S4 and data warehouses, in collaboration with MDM analysts
Identify opportunities for automation and process improvement within financial reporting and analysis
Ensure accuracy, consistency, and audit-readiness of all reporting outputs
Support Finance transformation initiatives and continuous improvement efforts across the global FinOps function


Your Profile


7‚Äì12 years of relevant experience in Finance Operations, Shared Services, or reporting roles within multinational environments
Solid understanding of OTC, P2P and R2R process cycles and how they impact business performance
Hands-on experience with SAP S4, and familiarity with systems such as Blackline or OneStream
Advanced Excel and strong proficiency with Tableau, Power BI, or other BI/reporting tools
Familiarity with SQL and data modeling concepts is a plus
Understanding of internal control frameworks and SOX compliance
Proven ability to deliver results in a matrixed, fast-paced, and changing environment
Fluency in English is required; knowledge of other European languages (e.g., Spanish, French) is a plus


Benefits

Life at Adevinta comes with its perks! Our Adevintans enjoy the following benefits:


An attractive Base Salary üí∏
Participation in our Short-Term Incentive plan (annual bonus) üèÜ
Work From Anywhere: Enjoy up to 20 days a year of working from anywhere! Maybe not from the moonüåõwell why not! just make sure you have internet connection! üåç
A 24/7 Employee Assistance Program for you and your family, because we care ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äç
Win together, lose together is one of our key behaviours. At Adevinta you will find a collaborative environment with an opportunity to explore your potential and grow üå±


On top of these, we also provide a range of locally relevant benefits. Wanna know more? Apply and ask our recruiters! ‚ú®

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don‚Äôt meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don‚Äôt meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
P2P.org is the largest institutional staking provider with a TVL of over $10B and a market share exceeding 20% in restaking.

We are continually focused on researching and improving our infrastructure to extract maximum APR while enhancing security. For instance, in ETH and SOL, our NRR is on average 10% higher than the market, and in DOT, it's 20% higher.

We also place significant focus and resources on launching new networks such as TON, Avail, Monad, Babylon, Story, Berachain, and others, along with yield products. From restaking, where we are the largest operator with a 20+% market share, to yield aggregators on stablecoins.

Our clients include BitGo, Copper, Crypto.com, Ledger, ByBit, Bitget, OKX, HTX, Bitvavo, SBI, and others, who choose us for our client-centric approach and extensive product line from unified API to widgets and custom dApps.

We are also actively expanding our product line, exploring RWA, data, yield, and service products for banks, exchanges, custodians, and wallets.

P2P.org unites talented individuals globally ‚ù§Ô∏è

Despite our distributed team, we share a passion for decentralized finance - a fairer system for all. We code, learn, create, and connect to shape finance's future üí∞

P2P.org boasts a strong reputation and network. We prioritize customer satisfaction and, as tech enthusiasts, develop innovative solutions that bolster our brand.

You will


Analyze large, complex datasets (on-chain and off-chain) to derive strategic and product insights
Develop models and dashboards to monitor validator performance, user behavior, and protocol performance
Investigate network economics, user incentives, and staking flows to support growth strategies, research new revenue opportunities
Conduct exploratory and root-cause analysis of ecosystem or performance changes
Build data tools and reporting frameworks to scale internal decision-making
Present insights and data stories clearly to technical and non-technical audiences


You have


5+ years of experience in data analysis, strategy, or research roles in tech, fintech, or crypto
Proficiency in advanced SQL and Python (must be comfortable working with large, complex datasets)
Strong business acumen and problem-solving skills ‚Äì ability to work from ambiguous problem statements to clear recommendations
Excellent written and verbal communication skills (English)
Experience with data visualization tools like Superset, Metabase, Looker, or Tableau
Bachelor's or Master‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or related field


Nice to have


Prior work in Web3, or an active interest in the crypto space
Experience with blockchain data platforms: Dune Analytics, The Graph, Flipside, etc.
Exposure to staking protocols, validator infrastructure, or DeFi analytics
Experience of building data pipelines with tools like dbt, Airflow etc.


At P2P.org we have a team of experts with their own unique approach and ownership culture. Together we gain experience and make dreams come true! üåü


Full-time Contractor (Indefinite-term Consultancy Agreement)
Competitive salary level in $ (we can also pay in Crypto)
Well-being program
Mental Health care program
Compensation for education, including Foreign Language & professional growth courses
Equipment & co-working reimbursement program
Overseas conferences, community immersion
Positive and friendly communication culture


P2P.org is committed to providing equal opportunities. All applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, or disability.


Show more

  • Bachelor's or Master‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or related field

Nice to have

  • Prior work in Web3, or an active interest in the crypto space
  • Experience with blockchain data platforms: Dune Analytics, The Graph, Flipside, etc.
  • Exposure to staking protocols, validator infrastructure, or DeFi analytics
  • Experience of building data pipelines with tools like dbt, Airflow etc.

At P2P.org we have a team of experts with their own unique approach and ownership culture. Together we gain experience and make dreams come true! üåü

  • Full-time Contractor (Indefinite-term Consultancy Agreement)
  • Competitive salary level in $ (we can also pay in Crypto)
  • Well-being program
  • Mental Health care program
  • Compensation for education, including Foreign Language & professional growth courses
  • Equipment & co-working reimbursement program
  • Overseas conferences, community immersion
  • Positive and friendly communication culture

P2P.org is committed to providing equal opportunities. All applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, or disability.

Title: Networks Data Analyst F/M
Description:
What You‚Äôll Be Doing

At Axa Partners, we are looking for our next Networks Data Analyst to be part of our data transformation journey and be part of the Motor Networks Cost Control department.

Data is a key part of AXA‚Äôs journey ‚Äúfrom Payer to Partner‚Äù, and its transformation to a Data Driven company. To succeed in this journey, AXA Partners data strategy has been organised around 6 dimensions: Data Value, Data Usage, Data Protection & Quality, Data Platform, Data Governance and Data Culture.

The Networks Data Analyst is therefore a cornerstone of the data transformation journey and he/she has to assist in the maintenance and creation of new reporting and analysis for both existing, new clients and internal clients from the existing MI database, ensuring throughout all performed analysis of the reliability and the business sense of the data. Networks Data Analyst interprets data and turns it into information which can offer ways to ease and improve business decisions. Networks Data Analysts gather information from various sources and interpret patterns and trends. Once data has been gathered and interpreted, the Data Analyst will report back what has been found in a comprehensive study to the wider business/relevant colleagues.

The post-holder will work closely with the Networks team, the Data teams and other teams to understand and define the report requirements and produce timely reports in a high quality format that can lead to decision making and partner discussions.

How Would Your Day To Day Be With Us


Provide business analysis and solutions for reporting requirements
Follow-up of Networks KPI‚Äôs and deviations alerts
Provide quality assurance of imported data
Commissioning and decommissioning of data sets
Processing confidential data and information according to guidelines
Helping develop reports and analysis
Managing and designing the reporting environment, including data sources
Supporting the data warehouse in identifying and revising reporting requirements
Supporting initiatives for data integrity and normalization
Generating reports from single or multiple systems
Training end-users on new reports and dashboards
Develop adhoc reports and analysis




What You‚Äôll Bring

You could be perfect for this role if you have :


Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel and PowerPoint
Degree in either Finance, Insurance, IT or Economics
Databases structures, Data Warehouse concepts, SQL knowledge
Experience with any visualisation tool such as Powerpivot, Power BI
Quickly understands the business issues and data challenges of clients organisation and industry
Ability to translate business requirements into non-technical, lay terms
Results orientated with good communication and interpersonal skills
Ability and willingness to take complex business requirements and progress them through analysis, development and final output
Clear analytical approach, with ability to manage financial data and statistics to deliver sophisticated outcomes
Excellent interpersonal and team-working skills with a helpful, flexible and solution-oriented approach
Able to maintain a calm and positive approach even under pressure or in conflicted situations


Desirable


Experience within Financial Services environment, Insurance specifically


To apply, click on the ‚Äòapply for this job‚Äô button, you‚Äôll then need to log in or create a profile to submit your CV. We‚Äôre proud to be an Equal Opportunities Employer and don‚Äôt discriminate against employees or potential employees based on protected characteristics.

Who We Are

We‚Äôre AXA Partners, experts at designing and delivering assistance solutions and specialised insurance, credit, and lifestyle protection - with and for our partners worldwide. What sets us apart? The expertise and passion of our 8,500+ people, and a strong network of over 55,000 professionals all over the world. Powered by them and our sector-leading technology, we continuously evolve, adapt and thrive - offering solutions and services that make sure we‚Äôre always at people‚Äôs side, no matter what. Helping others is our passion. Combining the best digital technology with our warm, human touch, we‚Äôre always looking at new ways to offer seamless and reassuring experiences when it really matters.

Join a company that helps protect the forests! At AXA Partners, we plant a tree for every new recruit (with a permanent contract)

Title: Data Analyst - Supply Operations - ECA (They/He/She)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: Building the largest marketplace in your city, to give access to anything in minutes. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

We are looking for a person with a positive attitude, lots of gas, creativity to think out of the box and passion for the work you will develop.

THE JOURNEY


Track courier performance and KPIs by analyzing historical operational metrics with a focus on company targets.
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Propose (be an enthusiast), track and consolidate new ideas to improve the operations by being obsessed with Glovo's KPIs.
Conduct A/B tests, analyze the results of each project and be able to easily replicate them in the rest of the countries.
Actively collaborate with other analysts in Glovo and learn from each other in a supportive environment that allows you to grow, develop and make a difference.
Build robust relationships with Data Analysts in the ECA region acting as a strategic and supportive link between the HQ and local markets.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


Minimum 1 year of experience outside of an academic and internship setting in a quantitative analysis role within start-ups, consulting firms, or large companies, ideally in Tech or FMCG
Bachelor Degree in Economics, Engineering or any business or technological domain
Excellent SQL and Excel/GoogleSheets skills
Knowledge of visualisation tools like Tableau, Looker and/or PowerBI
Passion about analytics: you enjoy deep diving into problems to find the root cause
Ability to manage multiple tasks, prioritize workload, and handle a fast-paced environment
High motivation to contribute to a fast-growing startup
Ability to work both independently and within a team
Capability of executing tasks quickly while maintaining a high standard of quality
Great spoken and written English
An empathetic, inclusive and curious attitude


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

  • üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
  • üí≥ Discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
  • üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
  • üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
  • üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
  • üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Title: BI Analyst Intern
Description:
What You'll Do:

The Global Reporting Team (GRT) at Criteo is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining a portfolio of performance reports across sales, business, and finance domains. As a BI Analyst Intern, you‚Äôll work in a fast-paced, data-driven environment where your contributions will directly impact decision-making across the company.

This internship offers a unique opportunity to deepen your technical skills while gaining exposure to a wide range of business functions. You‚Äôll collaborate with experienced analysts and stakeholders to deliver high-quality, automated reporting solutions.

As an intern, alongside the rest of the team, you will be responsible for :


Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and translate business needs into technical reporting requirements.
Design, build, and maintain dashboards and reports using SQL and BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Perform data validation, troubleshoot inconsistencies, and ensure data accuracy across reporting layers.
Automate recurring reporting processes using scripts or workflow tools.
Document processes, create user guides, and contribute to internal knowledge sharing.



Who You Are:


Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Business Analytics).
Strong analytical mindset with attention to detail and a proactive approach to problem-solving.
Excellent communication skills in English (spoken and written).
Comfortable working independently and collaboratively in a dynamic environment.
Demonstrated interest in data, analytics, and technology.
Technical skills required: SQL (ability to write complex queries, perform joins, etc), Excel (pivot tables, vlookup, data manipulation), understanding of ETL processes and data modeling concepts.
Bonus skills: BI Tools (experience with Power BI, Tableau, or similar visualization platforms), familiarity with cloud data platforms, basic Python for data analysis or automation.
English speaking fluency, Russian is considered a plus (not mandatory)



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is a leader in commerce media, helping brands, agencies, and publishers create meaningful consumer connections through AI-powered advertising solutions. We‚Äôre shaping a more open and sustainable digital future for advertising.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices across the globe or from the comfort of home, our 3,600 Criteos collaborate together to build an open, impactful, and forward-thinking environment.

We foster a workplace where everyone is valued, and employment decisions are based solely on skills, qualifications, and business needs‚Äînever on non-job-related factors or legally protected characteristics.

What We Offer:

üè† Own your work style ‚Äì Build your work around your life and not the other way around.

üìà Grow with us ‚Äì Learning, mentorship & career development programs.

üí™ Your wellbeing matters ‚Äì Health benefits, wellness perks & mental health support.

ü§ù A team that cares ‚Äì Diverse, inclusive, and globally connected.

üí∏ Fair pay & perks ‚Äì Competitive salary, equity, performance-based rewards and family-friendly policies.

Additional benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo.

Title: Data Analyst - Travel Industry
Description:
AIC Travel Group SAis a B2B travel company headquartered in Geneva, Switzerland, with over 20 years of experience in the tourism sector.

We are seeking a skilledData Analystwith proven expertise in thetravel and hospitality industry.


Responsibilities:


Drive data-led decisions forB2B travel partners(bedbanks, OTAs, DMCs) by analyzing hotel performance, market trends, and sales pipelines.

Build and manage dashboards inLooker Studio / Google Data Studio

Segment and automate campaigns and reports inHubSpot CRM

Provide actionable insights to support sales and marketing teams

Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and business intelligence metrics

Direct exposure to the CEO/management, offering visibility into strategic decision-making


Requirements:


2+ years of experience in the travel industry, ideally in a B2B environment (bedbanks, OTAs, DMCs, tour operators)

Proficiency withLooker Studio (Google Data Studio), Google Sheets, and advanced Excel

Hands-on experience withHubSpot CRM(reports, segmentation, workflows)

Strong analytical mindset and problem-solving skills

Self-driven, analytical mindset, remote collaboration fluency

Fluent inEnglish(mandatory); Italian/French/Spanish/German advantageous for EU market alignment


What We Offer:


A supportive and professional working environment

100% remote role, ideal for professionals seeking EU market access without relocation

A strategic position in a solid, fast-scaling Swiss company

Competitive compensation and motivational development aligned with your capabilities and responsibilities


If you are interested and possess the above qualities, please send your CV and motivation letter in English ****** the subject line: CV - Data Analyst - [Your Name].


Important Note:Only applications from candidates residing in the specified region and strictly meeting the above criteria will be considered for this position.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
At Reverse Tech, we are on a mission to create, launch, and scale digital product brands in the health and wellness space. Our goal is ambitious ‚Äì we aim to help 10 million people improve their health by 2030 through hyper-targeted, mass-scale brands. We specialize in subscription-based business models and pride ourselves on being results-focused, with no big egos, just big data.

What We Want to Achieve:

Our vision is to discover novel self-serve solutions to the world's greatest health problems, all while adhering to our core values.

We're looking for a Marketing Data Analyst¬†with expertise in audience clustering and segmentation to enhance the performance of our marketing efforts. We invest heavily across several digital ad channels, targeting various segments, and need an analyst to lead this area within our remote team.

You will collaborate with our Marketing, Data, and Tech teams to optimize existing campaigns and uncover new opportunity segments in our customer data using clustering models and other data science techniques.

Requirements

You have 3+ years of experience in customer and marketing analytics
Strong understanding of marketing metrics like LTV, CAC (CPI) and conversion funnels
Experienced in segmentation logic (demographic, behavioral, clustering techniques)
Proficient in BigQuery‚Äôs Standard SQL¬†
Practiced in exploratory data analysis using Python
Practical experience clustering (K-Means, Hierarchical, DBSCAN, Gaussian) data sets
Comfortable in a startup - Jira, slack, standups, proactively reaching teammates for¬†questions or support
Able to visualise data in Tableau or Looker
Fluent in English
Nice to have:
Experience in subscription model data analysis and performance marketing
DBT for data transformations
Experience with GA4, Segment and Meta/Google Ads platforms a plus
Experience with marketing mix modelling (MMM)¬†and multitouch attributions

Desired Skills


Uncover strategic insights: dive into customer and campaign data to surface new
target segments and campaign opportunities.
Define and monitor KPIs for our performance marketing segments. Track performance¬†across channels and validate new audience tests.
Build and maintain dashboards: own and evolve dashboards in Tableau, Looker
Studio, and Mixpanel. Ensure their accuracy, consistency and completeness.
Drive experimentation: help shape our A/B testing culture. Design tests, analyze
results, and promote experimentation as a core growth lever.

Our Values:

Care: We support and stand by our team members in any situation, ensuring that no one is left behind.
Extreme Ownership: We take responsibility not only for tasks under our direct control but for anything that impacts our mission's success.
Identification: We take pride in being part of something bigger than ourselves, with the goal of changing the world by helping people get healthier.
Communication: We value honesty and direct language, fostering a culture free of politics.
Performance: We believe in providing full freedom while striving for top-notch performance from everyone.
Trust: We value the words and qualities of our team members, fostering an environment of trust and respect


Benefits

What Our Team Members Get:

100% remote and flexible work hours
Top notch equipment (MacBook Pro or PC, you decide)
Full-time or freelance opportunities
Learning from the best, including ex-Googlers and more
Unlimited growth prospects
Inclusion in a winning team
Competitive compensation
A fun, non-corporate atmosphere

If you're passionate about (Engineering, have experience in Full Stack), and are ready to join a dynamic, global team, we encourage you to apply. Help us shape the future of health and wellness through technology.

Learn more about us at https://www.reverse.tech/ and apply today to become a key player in our exciting journey.

*This position is offered as a Remote option, reach out to us to evaluate the options according to your location.

Title: Transport Master Data Analyst
Description:
Master Data Analyst (Transport)

Master Data Analyst would be part of a team, in charge of transport MD process, running enrichment processes and maintenance of master data for Coty worldwide on a global SAP platform.

Responsibilities

You would be responsible for ensuring that the Transport Master Data is created on time and accurate as per briefing from Logistics/Transport department. You are following the Global Data Standards provided by our Data Governance Team and contributing to adjust them to changing needs. As Coty‚Äôs growth builds on constant new product developments, this position plays a key role delivering ‚ÄúData Readiness‚Äù during different stages of the Innovation and leading the work across.

Your main focus:


Coordination of the daily Transport Master Data communications
Daily Transport Master Data alignment with the 4PL (new lanes, lane changes, new locations, location terminations and Data alignment)
Data gathering, alignment and validation with source data owners for creation and maintenance of lanes in the Transportation master data database (SAP cloud-BTP)
Data requests to source data owner to ensure transport master data availability
Reporting on lane data to several internal parties
Support on reporting improvements
Follow up on Data quality topics
Deliver Key Performance Indicators, making sure to reach the Service Level Agreement targets.
Root cause and log.


Working for Coty means being part of one of the largest beauty companies with an iconic portfolio of brands across fragrance, color cosmetics, skin care and body care. We are a global leader in fragrance and number three in color cosmetics and our products are sold in over 150 countries around the world. COTY and its brands are committed to a range of social causes, embraces diversity as well as seeking to minimize its impact on the environment. You can work in a truly international and dynamic work environment, in a culture based on trust and cooperation with opportunities of continues improvement and learning with the freedom to be yourself.

The team consists today of nine Master Data Analyst. You will work closely together with several departments such as Master Data Governance, Initiative leaders, Logistics, Planning, etc. All your colleagues are dedicated experts and ready to drive Coty to the next level. Working with a team environment with can do attitude, optimistic, focus on finding solutions. The team has a continuous improvement mindset, committed to resolving upcoming challenges and opportunities, to make processes more efficient. Master data community main characteristics are team spirit, collaboration and working together cohesively toward common goals. They willingly share knowledge and resources, help when needed, and celebrate each other's successes.

YOU ARE A COTY FIT

You like to focus on the results and be able to react to the business‚Äôs need with sensibility. As a/an experienced Master Data Analyst, you collaborate and work together with other teams, and you get energy from working in a fast-paced, diverse, and international environment.

Other than that, you:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree (Engineering, BA and/or similar academic background).
Good technical skills in Excel and SAP. Knowledge in Microsoft Access, Visual Basic will be considered.
Root Cause Analysis (RCA) mentality, with ability to propose and deliver improvements.
Team Player mindset.
Strong sense of individual accountability ‚Äì personal drive to improve and passionate ownership of performance.
Autonomous motivation to implement changes and challenge the current process / system to deliver improved results.
Good English level and communication skills.


Our Benefits

As our Master Data Analyst some of the benefits you will receive are:


A salary that matches your knowledge and experience
Omni-Working: Hybrid flexible working model enabling employees to balance remote and office-based work and promote work / life balance.
Flexible working hours
Meal voucher
Medical & Physiotherapy Service


RECRUITMENT PROCESS


A telephone/online introductory meeting.
A first online/in-person interview
A second interview
You will receive a proposal with the terms of employment.


About Coty

Coty is one of the world‚Äôs largest beauty companies with an iconic portfolio of brands across fragrance, color cosmetics, skincare, and body care. At Coty, we celebrate the entire human kaleidoscope and cultivate a culture of fearless kindness. Therefore, we are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. We do not discriminate against any candidate or employee and strive to be an open, inclusive and diverse workplace where all employees can be their authentic self. Join us in making over the world of beauty!

Title: Sr. Data Analyst
Description:
Job Requisition ID #

25WD88843

Position Overview

Data is central to measuring all aspects of our business and critical to our growth. We‚Äôre looking for someone to join Autodesk‚Äôs Product Development & Manufacturing Services organization as a Sr. Data Analyst.

Collaborate with business partners across Finance, Sales, Marketing and Product as a key member of our analytics team.

As a motivated self-starter you will be able to work in a fast paced, ambiguous environment. Proven attention to detail and an extensive eye for business will allow you to work efficiently with business partners across Finance, Sales, Product and Marketing to build business narratives and metrics for success. Additionally, you will define and test hypotheses, and deliver practical insights through data visualizations. You will succeed by having an eye on the big picture and challenge the status quo. Ask the hard questions to ensure investment of time and resources is warranted.

Responsibilities


Design and instrument key performance metrics, in partnership with the business growth and strategy teams. Deliver weekly and quarterly analysis of leading indicators and results
Define data model requirements that are scalable and focus on immediate business outcomes and results
Build self-serve tools and advanced visualizations that democratize access to data insights
Conduct in-depth ecosystem analyses that tell the story of what happened and how to improve
Improve internal process and stakeholder documentation guides


Minimum Qualifications


5+ years industry experience in data analytics / data visualization role, including 3+ years experience communicating analytical findings to executives. Experience includes metric dashboarding, storytelling, and presentation skills, and making recommendations based on data backed insights
Mastery of SQL in a cloud data warehouse environment
Mastery of data visualization software and design skills (PowerBI required; Looker or Tableau is a bonus)
Experience with data pipelines, ETL processes and a demonstrable understanding of database design principles (e.g. GitHub, DBT, Airflow, etc.)
Reporting experience across Sales, Marketing and Product (e.g. Salesforce, Marketo, Amplitude, etc.)
Degree in quantitative field or equivalent experience


Preferred Qualifications


Familiarity with product analytics, clickstream datasets, or UX-related framework and tools


#AC-1

About Autodesk

Welcome to Autodesk! Amazing things are created every day with our software ‚Äì from the greenest buildings and cleanest cars to the smartest factories and biggest hit movies. We help innovators turn their ideas into reality, transforming not only how things are made, but what can be made.

We take great pride in our culture here at Autodesk ‚Äì it‚Äôs at the core of everything we do. Our culture guides the way we work and treat each other, informs how we connect with customers and partners, and defines how we show up in the world.

When you‚Äôre an Autodesker, you can do meaningful work that helps build a better world designed and made for all. Ready to shape the world and your future? Join us!

Salary transparency

Salary is one part of Autodesk‚Äôs competitive compensation package. Offers are based on the candidate‚Äôs experience and geographic location. In addition to base salaries, our compensation package may include annual cash bonuses, commissions for sales roles, stock grants, and a comprehensive benefits package.

Diversity & Belonging

We take pride in cultivating a culture of belonging where everyone can thrive. Learn more here: https://www.autodesk.com/company/diversity-and-belonging

Title: BI Analyst Intern
Description:
This job is with Criteo, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork ‚Äì the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.

What You'll Do

The Global Reporting Team (GRT) at Criteo is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining a portfolio of performance reports across sales, business, and finance domains. As a BI Analyst Intern, you'll work in a fast-paced, data-driven environment where your contributions will directly impact decision-making across the company.

This internship offers a unique opportunity to deepen your technical skills while gaining exposure to a wide range of business functions. You'll collaborate with experienced analysts and stakeholders to deliver high-quality, automated reporting solutions.

As an intern, alongside the rest of the team, you will be responsible for :


Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and translate business needs into technical reporting requirements.
Design, build, and maintain dashboards and reports using SQL and BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Perform data validation, troubleshoot inconsistencies, and ensure data accuracy across reporting layers.
Automate recurring reporting processes using scripts or workflow tools.
Document processes, create user guides, and contribute to internal knowledge sharing.


Who You Are


Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Business Analytics).
Strong analytical mindset with attention to detail and a proactive approach to problem-solving.
Excellent communication skills in English (spoken and written).
Comfortable working independently and collaboratively in a dynamic environment.
Demonstrated interest in data, analytics, and technology.
Technical skills required: SQL (ability to write complex queries, perform joins, etc), Excel (pivot tables, vlookup, data manipulation), understanding of ETL processes and data modeling concepts.
Bonus skills: BI Tools (experience with Power BI, Tableau, or similar visualization platforms), familiarity with cloud data platforms, basic Python for data analysis or automation.
English speaking fluency, Russian is considered a plus (not mandatory)


We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we'd love to see your application!

Who We Are

Criteo is a leader in commerce media, helping brands, agencies, and publishers create meaningful consumer connections through AI-powered advertising solutions. We're shaping a more open and sustainable digital future for advertising.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices across the globe or from the comfort of home, our 3,600 Criteos collaborate together to build an open, impactful, and forward-thinking environment.

We foster a workplace where everyone is valued, and employment decisions are based solely on skills, qualifications, and business needs-never on non-job-related factors or legally protected characteristics.

What We Offer

üè† Own your work style - Build your work around your life and not the other way around.

üìà Grow with us - Learning, mentorship & career development programs.

üí™ Your wellbeing matters - Health benefits, wellness perks & mental health support.

ü§ù A team that cares - Diverse, inclusive, and globally connected.

üí∏ Fair pay & perks - Competitive salary, equity, performance-based rewards and family-friendly policies.

Additional benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo.

Title: Electronics & Data Analysis Internship
Description:
Are you an analytical person who enjoys Big Data analysis? Do you have an electronics background and want to grow in this area? HP Inc and be part of one of the most recognized supply chains in the industry!

We are the Procurement team for electromechanical parts within the Large Format Printing Business and 3D Business (aka LFP & 3D). We take care of direct materials procurement, and our deliverables are directly linked with the parts specifications, availability and suitability for all our needs.

PPSC is the acronym for the whole HP Procurement team and concerns the supply chain inbound.

Main Responsibilities


Support PPSC Large Format Printing and 3D EMECH team in the development of analysis tools to support Printed Circuit Assembly industrialization, design, and production.
Focus in the spend analytics, tracking and impact analysis for the various Manufacturer Partners.
Help the PPSC senior engineers with the different guidelines to be developed, maintained and communication WITH R&D and Operations Communities.
Be part of the PPSC electronics team, working closely to RD and operations to optimize Electronics design in terms of EE components selection, and cost analysis
Develop the data analysis layer for tracking Quality Data to improve industrialization activities, test coverage and faster TAT for corrective actions.


What are we looking for?


Fourth-year student, as well as master‚Äôs, currently enrolled in electronics or industrial engineering. Other related disciplines may be acceptable, depending on the technical knowledge. Academic agreement is required. Interest in Data Mining and Big Data would be a plus.
Tools needed: MS Office (PowerPoint, Excel, etc.), Power BI. Knowledge in coding would be a plus.
Strong data analytics and reporting skills: ability to analyze data and interpret it accurately to get conclusions.
Proactive, curious, and dynamic personality: Capacity and eagerness to learn quickly new tools, processes, methods, etc.
Autonomous and self-sufficient person: availability to work on your own and take risks on decisions and new solutions that need to be created.
Fluent in English.


Experience Our Benefits

Being part of HP means access to an international community with lots of growth opportunities within the company, professional development resources, networking opportunities, while enjoying in a great atmosphere making an impact.


You will be able to choose to either work office-based or hybrid work style.
Flexible schedule for part time (4h/day) or full time (8h/day) for a 3 to12 months agreement.
Lunch in the cafeteria.
Love sports? Then take advantage of our sports center (indoor and outdoor); gym, squash courts, tennis courts, basketball courts and with 25+ regular coordinated activities / sports , such as HIIT training, squash,‚ÄØbasketball and yoga.
A Young employee Network (YEN) which host fun events on a regular basis, such as ‚Äúbeer bust‚Äù Fridays at different venues including the beach in the summertime.
We have an onsite Doctor and medical team for our employees, including services such as: nutrition, physiotherapy and general health.
Free printing Happy hour ‚Äì from photographs to large posters. And Hands-on‚ÄØworkshops‚ÄØto print with the latest technology ‚Äì from wall covers to 3D printed models.


Sounds like you? Please apply and let‚Äôs talk!
